abstract: If you are a hard-core Outlook user living inside Microsoft’s mail, contacts and calendar program, you don’t even have to switch to a browser to update your Facebook status.
snippet: If you are a hard-core Outlook user living inside Microsoft’s mail, contacts and calendar program, you don’t even have to switch to a browser to update your Facebook status.
lead_paragraph: If you are a hard-core Outlook user living inside Microsoft’s mail, contacts and calendar program, you don’t even have to switch to a browser to update your Facebook status. TechHit’s FBLook add-in puts an extra line on the toolbar that lets you update your status right from Outlook, set it to show what song is playing in Windows Media Player or iTunes, see the status lines of your friends and check other notifications. FBLook works with Outlook 2003 and 2007 (but not Outlook Express) and can be downloaded at www.techhit.com/FBLook.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Updating Facebook From Outlook
